conclusion: When the blue-purple ball (A) is released, gravity pulls it straight down.
Because it falls into a loose ring of light plastic cubes, whichever cube it touches first will be pushed outward.
The ball will roll or bounce off that cube and continue on the same general downward-and-slightly-rightward path shown in the first frame.
The second and third frames confirm that the deflection is small and that A keeps moving rightward.
Therefore A will end up colliding with – and finally coming to rest against – the cube that is already positioned farthest to the right in the ring.
